comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

When one clicks the home button, back button, etc. you have to click at the top rim of the button for it to be responsive. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open Firefox
2.Try clicking a button
3.

Actual Results:  
nothing. I proceeded to click around the button until i found the spot that worked.

Expected Results:  
The button should have worked no matter where i clicked it.

N/A
comments.creator: cab0053@hotmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

When one clicks the home button, back button, etc. you have to click at the top rim of the button for it to be responsive. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open Firefox
2.Try clicking a button
3.

Actual Results:  
nothing. I proceeded to click around the button until i found the spot that worked.

Expected Results:  
The button should have worked no matter where i clicked it.

N/A
comments.author: cab0053@hotmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.text:
Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile?

comments.text: In safe mode they all are fixed except for the back button.
comments.raw_text: In safe mode they all are fixed except for the back button.
comments.creator: cab0053@hotmail.com
comments.author: cab0053@hotmail.com
mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.text:
Strange about the back button. Except that, it sound like an extension problem.

https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Troubleshooting+extensions+and+themes#w_test-for-faulty-extensions

Are you able to track down which extension is the problematic one?
comments.raw_text:
Strange about the back button. Except that, it sound like an extension problem.

https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Troubleshooting+extensions+and+themes#w_test-for-faulty-extensions

Are you able to track down which extension is the problematic one?
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu

comments.raw_text: I have tried disabling every extension individually and in combinations. still no difference.
comments.creator: cab0053@hotmail.com
comments.text: I have tried disabling every extension individually and in combinations. still no difference.
comments.author: cab0053@hotmail.com
mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.raw_text:
And how about with a new, clean profile - are you still able to reproduce the problem then?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
comments.text:
And how about with a new, clean profile - are you still able to reproduce the problem then?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile

comments.creator: cab0053@hotmail.com
comments.raw_text: starting with a clean profile fixed the problem, but i dont know how to transfer my passwords and bookmarks over to the new profile.
comments.text: starting with a clean profile fixed the problem, but i dont know how to transfer my passwords and bookmarks over to the new profile.
comments.author: cab0053@hotmail.com

comments.text: Or try resetting the toolbars to default in your old profile.
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text: Or try resetting the toolbars to default in your old profile.
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
